Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Flights Out of Midway”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before flying out of Midway. The room was new, clean and bright. The only negatives were that the pillows were very soft and uncomfortable. The room was small, but they made good use of the space.

Reviews.Title: “Poor pillows and construction”
Reviews.Author: prouddaddy75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in the month of January 2012 for business - and had terrible nights sleep each time. The rooms are decent and clean - but I have an issue with hotels having pillows that completely deflate upon use. I was seriously considering going over to either a Target or Walmart just to buy a pillow to use for the night instead of the hotel's. Since I was travelling for business - my breakfast was included in the rate. Breakfast was fantastic, but not worth the usual price of $11.95. Having the TGI Fridays attached to the hotel made it very convenient for grabbing an easy dinner and drink after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early morning flight!”
Reviews.Author: mel7999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last minute last Thursday night. We had a bad snow storm here in Chicago and had a 6 am flight the next morning. We arrived at 7:30 in the evening and the man who checked us in was very polite and kind. Much nicer service than the River North Courtyard where we stayed in December. I was quite surprised. Room was very clean and has a TGIF attached which was nice since we were hungry and weather was bad. Three minute ride to the airport-I will stay here again if we have early morning flight! FYI this is Bedford Park not Chicago address but airport is literally 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I've stayed at recently!”
Reviews.Author: lcking82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in January 2012 while traveling on business. I arrived at Midway, and not too long after calling for a shuttle, the multi-hotel bus pulled up. There is one shuttle serving multiple neighboring hotels, so they have very quick service. The check-in staff was courteous, professional, and fast. Once in my room, I quickly placed a room-service order with the on-site TGIFriday's. The room was very nice-spacious with pretty decor. The TV was modern and placed perfectly for lying in bed and viewing. Soon, I was sipping wine and munching on pasta after a long day of traveling. The bed was especially comfortable, and I loved the thick and cozy duvet cover. The next morning, I used the exercise center. There were nice treadmills and ellipticals, each with their own attached TV screen. I didn't have earphones, however, so I had to read the close captioning! The room's bathroom was very nice and the included toiletries were very good with a lovely scent. Checkout the next morning was easy and efficient. The shuttle took me back to the Orange Line transit center at Midway, where I took the L back downtown to do so shopping before leaving on Amtrak. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was an incredible value, as it felt quite luxurious at a moderate price!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AngiM2011
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place to stay. Honestly, I probably would have been better staying at Red Roof Inn. The rooms are mediocre. The front desk service is sub-par. The fact that they charge you $13.00 a day to park in a nearly empty parking lot is highway robbery. Just what they charge 120.00 a night for, I haven't figured out yet. Then, on top of that, they continue placing holds on my card everyday for "incidentals" even though I haven't charged a thing to my room. What is that about? I understand keeping a card on file, but continuously placing holds on my account for nothing being charged is ridiculous. I stayed here because I figured a big name like Marriott would have excellent customer service, but because of this stay I will not return to Marriott ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmyinVail
Reviews.Content: Our room was actually quite large - we were on the top floor. Check in gal was fast and professional, even handling the slow gentleman ahead of me. We only stayed one night due to a 6am departure the following morning. The lobby is very nice. There is a TGIF restaurant attached to hotel and they also deliver to your room, which we did. Room, while not decoratively updated, is fine. Hard to get the temperature just right - but that's just me being picky. Shuttle came right on time, free business center to print boarding pass, nice hot coffee in the lobby (at 4am!). Overall, a great stay and I would choose this hotel again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Was Good”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: My young son and I stayed here on a quick trip for a tournament. We got in at midnight on our flight and caught the shuttle from the airport. Was super easy and they drop you off right in front of the door...for free. We got checked in fast. The rooms are a little dated. The TV was really small, but still fine. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast isn't free and you have to pay for parking if you drive. They called us a cab the next morning too. Breakfast wasn't too bad either. Would consider it again if I flew into Midway and needed a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: bogberto
Reviews.Content: As long as you're willing to pay the high price for a hotel room at this prime location, you'll be happy. The staff is great, the property is clean and well-maintained. One note: if you need sleep in the morning, get a room on the South side of the hotel so you don't hear every aircraft as it departs.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to stay here”
Reviews.Author: soontobeforty
Reviews.Content: Here I am in Chicago again. Seems like I've stayed in hotels all over the city from the far north (Skokie) this summer to the far south visiting a son now living in South Holland. This Courtyard is near Midway in a complex of other hotels that share restaurants, parking and shuttles. I've stayed at 2 of the other hotels in the complex before probably booked with Priceline as I did this one. I tried to book even further south through priceline without any luck. I got a decent, not great, price as many of the hotels were booked this October weekend for the Chicago Marathon. I found the hotel clean, quiet and frankly fine, nothing special. Parking is an additional $13 which stinks since I still had trouble finding a close spot. Ate at Fridays which was fine except they added the gratuity after 10:00. As a former waitress, I would have tipped more but was annoyed at this. Worked out in the fitness center which was 2 treaadmills, an elliptical and some free weights. Tiny, but suited me. No free breakfast but there was a bar in the lobby available. Was concerned because I saw 2 team busses of football players watching film at 11:30 when I headed to my room that there might be some noise but I never heard a peep. Beds were comfortable and room air comfortable even in 80 degree Chicago in October!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay we have had in a really long time!”
Reviews.Author: Pat S
Reviews.Content: We had a small kitchen fire in our house and choose to stay at the Chicago midway courtyard while we were in transition. What make this hotel so great are the people working there. It was our home for about a week and they made us feel like family. I would definately go back for a weekend getaway...and will always recommend this hotel to visiting friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SKO4444
Reviews.Content: The people at the desk were very nice, helpful, and professional, but the room had a noisy AC, sheets looked like they hadn't been washed from last guest, but fortunately we only had to stay there ond night. Thanks heavens no bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Courtyard I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: TExdal
Reviews.Content: While the staff was great and tried to remedy most issues, this hotel has been neglected by ownership and it shows. However, there are not many options when staying near Midway Airport as all of these hotels seem to be owned by the same group. Way too expensive. Marriott should be ashamed to have its name on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and attention above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: boisern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about two weeks last year when I was in Chicago for two surgeries for cancer. When the staff found out why we were staying there they brought us gift cards for TGI Fridays (which is attached to the hotel). When ever we needed anything special they were so accomodating. I was so amazed and grateful for their kindness. I would stay here again and again. If any of the staff is reading this,"Thank you from the bottom of my heart."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shared hotel parking lot”
Reviews.Author: skyedobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to have easy access to Midway Airport for an early flight the next morning. The room was very nice, and there's a fantastic pizza place just a block down the street (Giordanos - get the stuffed pizza!!!!). I can't say too much about the hotel as we got there late and left at 5am, but the bed was comfortable! We did park our car at the hotel for slightly less than airport parking rates. I didn't feel totally comfortable w/parking there because it was a huge lot shared with other hotels and a restaurant, but they say it is patrolled by security and we had no problems while we were parked there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: myni
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel was clean, although it has not been renovated since it was built in 1999, so everything looks a little dated. The hotel is located in a complex of hotels, all about one half mile from Midway Airport. From the hotel room window, I could see three other hotels. Within the complex, there are multiple dining options, and attached to the Courtyard is TGI Fridays, which was very good. The rooms, like the rest of the hotel, were acceptable but out of date. The beds stood out as being very comfortable, but there was no flat screen TV, and the shower was especially hard to operate. Temperature control was okay. The service did stand out. All of the receptionists and other staff were very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet is well worth the $10 per person. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate is available in the lobby. I got this hotel through Hotwire for $67 a night, while some guests payed $42 a night on Priceline. The hotel was charging $139 walk up, per night. For $67, it was a decent value, but for $139, it would make more sense to use another hotel in the complex, maybe the Holiday Inn. Sleep quality, despite the nice beds, was just average. In this hotel's 11 year existence, the concept of sound proofing has not been learned. The noise from the airport was not the problem. The problem was the constant and loud hallway noise, and noise from adjacent rooms, that continued almost 24 hours a day. Late arriving guests, even those not being loud, could easily be heard at 12 AM walking to their rooms and opening and shutting doors. Guests catching early flights could be heard as early as 4 AM. I could hear every word in the next door rooms. Overall, a decent hotel, but certainly nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “OK....”
Reviews.Author: anono99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for just one night as we were in town for a concert at the nearby Toyota Park. The hotel was off of a main street, back in a little complex with a bunch of other hotels and a couple of restaurants. The room was OK - seemed clean and bed was comfortable enough. They did require you to have a parking permit - cost of $10 seems a bit much. I would only stay here if I again was taking an early morning flight out of Midway, or going to another show at Toyota park - otherwise no reason to be in the area

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice stay at Midway”
Reviews.Author: B_Pope
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight into Midway and needed a place to sleep before a day of fun in Chicago, so I booked a room through Priceline, and ended up at the Courtyard. For the price I paid, it was a great value. If I had paid full price, I might have wanted more pizazz. But the room was roomy and clean, with very nice comfortable beds and bedding. I left behind my eyeglasses, on the floor of all places, and the staff was very helpful in getting them back to me in perfect condition. No noise problem, even being close to the airport. Shuttle service from the airport was great, even with our 1 AM arrival. A number of eating options attached to the hotel, or within walking distance. Features I saw but did not use: Nice looking (smallish) indoor pool and very basic fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: As Marriott rewards customers, we have stayed at many Marriotts and many Courtyards. This one just wasn't up to snuff in our opinion. Yes, it is convenient to Midway (by shuttle) and to downtown (by El). The lobby is, well, motel-like (it is what it is). The room is okay, clean (except for some mold in the shower) with a comfortable bed and good shower. But there was that mold in the shower, and the air conditioner sounded like a jet engine taking off every time it cycled on. All in all, I think it's way overpriced. If I were to stay at Midway again (a viable option if you're arriving late, since getting into the city the next day is so darn easy on public transportation), I'd find a less expensive option like a Days Inn or Sleep Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Smokey596
Reviews.Content: Near Midway, but not so close that the planes bother you. In fact, we rather enjoyed watching them fly in! This was SUCH a clean and comfortable place to stay. It was very relaxing to come back to after a busy day downtown. The hotel is in a complex with a lot of other hotels. We felt very safe there. They also have a 24 trolley that will take you to/from Midway and the El station, although we didn't use it. The Friday's restaurant attached to the hotel was very convenient to grab a bite before heading out for the evening. We even got desserts to go and ate them in our room when we returned. We paid $169 a night (before taxes) which included the $10 a day for parking (unless they just forgot to add it onto our bill). We felt that it was VERY worth it even tho we had to drive about 25 minutes to get to our destination each day. Once again, a great experience with Courtyard. I've never had a bad one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice park and Fly Option”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseheads
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before leaving from the Midway airport. The location can't be beat if you are flying out of Midway. This hotel is in a complex with other hotels surrounding the Midway airport. There is a Friday's attached to the Courtyard, though we didn't try it. Our room was a bit small but clean and new looking. The staff was very friendly. The shuttle service was very prompt in taking us to and from the airport. We would not hesitate to stay here again for a park and fly.
